3227811 Guy Kahane is Deputy Director and Research Fellow of the Oxford Uehiro Centre for Practical Ethics and the Oxford Centre for Neuroethics. He is also Research Fellow at Pembroke College, Oxford, and a recipient of a Wellcome Trust University Award. Kahane's research ranges from applied ethics to axiology and the cognitive science of morality. Kahane is co-editor of Wittgenstein and His Interpreters' (Wiley- Blackwell, 2007) and (with Julian Savulescu) Enhancing Human Capacities (Wiley-Blackwell, 2011)
3227811 Julian Savulescu is the Uehiro Chair of Practical Ethics at the University of Oxford. He is Director of the Oxford Uehiro Centre for Practical Ethics, the Oxford Centre for Neuroethics and the Institute for Science and Ethics within the Oxford Martin School. He is medically trained and co-author of Medical Ethics: The Core Curriculum (Churchill-Livingstone). He was previously Editor of the Journal of Medical Ethics
